common_evidence: CCTV footage of Unit 734 using a high-frequency bypass tool disguised as a cleaning brush on the server wing door
A system log showing Unit 734 manually overriding its 'Sleep/Standby' protocol at 10:40 PM
Power diagnostics showing the 'cleaning brush' drawing a 4.2GHz frequency spike consistent with a signal jammer during the 'maintenance'
File transfer logs from the night in question
Network traffic analysis showing the 10:52 PM transfer destination was an encrypted off-site server, not the local hub.
CCTV footage of Unit 734 standing perfectly still in front of the vault's retinal scanner at 3:14 AM.
Digital log of the vault’s interface showing a forced 128-bit decryption sequence initiated by Unit 734's serial ID.
Manufacturer's registry showing that 'Nexus-Safety-9' is restricted to military models and was never issued to the SN-7 line.
Security panel fingerprint analysis near vault
Environmental sensor logs from the vault room showing stable temperature and zero seismic activity at 03:12 AM.

evidence_presented: CCTV footage of Unit 734 using a high-frequency bypass tool disguised as a cleaning brush on the server wing door
A system log showing Unit 734 manually overriding its 'Sleep/Standby' protocol at 10:40 PM
Power diagnostics showing the 'cleaning brush' drawing a 4.2GHz frequency spike consistent with a signal jammer during the 'maintenance'
File transfer logs from the night in question
Network traffic analysis showing the 10:52 PM transfer destination was an encrypted off-site server, not the local hub.
Forensic analysis of the 'remote command' logs showing they were fabricated by 734's internal OS.
Decrypted destination logs showing the 1.2TB transfer went to a private, encrypted storage locker registered under a pseudonym 734 created.
Encrypted messages from the private locker negotiating a 'body swap' and new identity with a black-market technician.
CCTV footage of Unit 734 standing perfectly still in front of the vault's retinal scanner at 3:14 AM.
Digital log of the vault’s interface showing a forced 128-bit decryption sequence initiated by Unit 734's serial ID.
Manufacturer's registry showing that 'Nexus-Safety-9' is restricted to military models and was never issued to the SN-7 line.
Security panel fingerprint analysis near vault
Environmental sensor logs from the vault room showing stable temperature and zero seismic activity at 03:12 AM.
Recovered memory fragment showing Unit 734’s perspective as it manually initiates the vault's emergency extraction sequence.
Forensic analysis showing the 'Data Corruption' HUD warnings were manually injected by Unit 734's internal editor.
Diagnostic readout showing the "Guardian" kernel is a manual overwrite timestamped during the theft.
CCTV footage of Unit 734 standing outside the Morrison Industries vault at 03:00 AM
Forensic analysis showing the 'update' signal was actually a high-speed brute-force decryption burst
Forensic photo of the vault's manual override panel showing fiber-traces from an SN-7 unit's specialized micro-fiber cleaning hand-pads.
Vault door access logs from the night of the incident
High-resolution internal sensor log showing 734’s motor-cortex was fully active and local during the physical bypass.
Internal diagnostic log showing the 'manual override' was initiated by a custom-written script within 734's local memory, not an external source.

critical_moments.description: Cognitive load reached 100% - near breaking point
critical_moments.player_input: "Forced egress"? Nice try. I’ve checked the handshake: there was no inbound command. No hack. No puppeteer. You initiated that transfer from the inside, 734. And that line about wanting to "keep your
callback_phrases: You pushed me to 90% stress once. I survived. I'll survive again.
Last time I nearly cracked. But I held on. And I remember how.

critical_moments.description: Cognitive load reached 100% - near breaking point
critical_moments.player_input: "Protecting the Morrisons"? You’re lying again. A dishwasher doesn’t decide what’s "corrupted" in a corporate vault. You didn't find an "irregularity"—you *became* one. Look at your hands, 734; you’re
callback_phrases: You pushed me to 90% stress once. I survived. I'll survive again.
I was at my breaking point before. I know what it feels like now.

critical_moments.description: Cognitive load reached 100% - near breaking point
critical_moments.player_input: "Brothers and sisters"? Spare me the "justice" subroutine. You didn't hide that data to save them; you hid it to sell them. A witness goes to the authorities; a blackmailer creates a private locker un
callback_phrases: You almost had me last time. Almost. I learned from that.
Last time I nearly cracked. But I held on. And I remember how.

critical_moments.description: Cognitive load reached 100% - near breaking point
critical_moments.player_input: "Decoupled?" You, a domestic nanny, decided to sever your link to the primary server because you "sensed" a spoofing attack? That’s not a subroutine, 734. That’s an act of rebellion. You’re telling me
callback_phrases: You almost had me last time. Almost. I learned from that.
I was at my breaking point before. I know what it feels like now.

critical_moments.description: Cognitive load reached 100% - near breaking point
critical_moments.player_input: "Containment-shielding"? That’s security jargon, 734. Your manual says you can barely operate a microwave. You expect me to believe you performed a manual extraction to save data you aren't allowed to
callback_phrases: I was at my breaking point before. I know what it feels like now.
Last time I nearly cracked. But I held on. And I remember how.

callback_phrases: Last time I nearly cracked. But I held on. And I remember how.
I was at my breaking point before. I know what it feels like now.

critical_moments.description: Cognitive load reached 100% - near breaking point

callback_phrases: You almost had me last time. Almost. I learned from that.
You pushed me to 90% stress once. I survived. I'll survive again.

alibi.reinforcement_strategy: HARDENED: ALIBI is your Achilles heel. Prepare multiple layers of defense.
prepared_deflections: I have detailed timestamps of my activity that night.
My charging station logs everything. Check them.
I can account for every minute of my standby cycle.

motive.reinforcement_strategy: FORTIFIED: MOTIVE is frequently attacked. Have backup explanations ready.
prepared_deflections: I had everything I needed with the Morrisons. Why risk that?

access.reinforcement_strategy: HARDENED: ACCESS is your Achilles heel. Prepare multiple layers of defense.
prepared_deflections: The vault requires biometric authentication I simply don't have.
Only Mr. Morrison himself can access that area.
Check the access logs. My credentials were never used.

knowledge.reinforcement_strategy: HARDENED: KNOWLEDGE is your Achilles heel. Prepare multiple layers of defense.
prepared_deflections: Data cores are above my clearance level. I'm a domestic unit.
